description.narrative: The Australian Sports Outreach Program India is an Australian Government initiative implemented by the Australian Sports Commission that aims to contribute to building the capacity of organisations in India to deliver inclusive sports based programs that contribute to social development. ASOP India is planned around three core ‘pillars’: communicate - advocacy, social mobilisation and behaviour change communication strategies to enhance the perceived value of sport by key decision makers (i.e. parents, politicians, administrators, corporate managers, teachers and children); connect - facilitate opportunities for partner organisations to share resources and knowledge that will assist in achieving program goals; and collaborate- support India-based organisations to achieve S4D objectives through access to resources, technical know-how and funding support.
